chav1961.purelib.i18n

Class MultilangStringRepo

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.i18n.MultilangStringRepo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class MultilangStringRepo
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable

    This class describes a repository for MultilangString entites. Every entity identifies in the repository by it;s unique key. Repository can be filled by individual call by add(String, MultilangString) method, by bulk method add(MultilangStringRepo) or by import repository content from XML DOM tree. This class can also substitute multilang strings into the given string content (method substitute(String))

    Repository content can be any subtree of the XML DOM tree and is a sequence of items:

    <item key="key"><value locale="Locale.NAME">CONTENT</value>...</item>

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    MultilangString, JUnit tests

      • substitute

        public String substitute(String source)
                  throws ContentException

        Substitute string with the multilanguage string context. Source string can contains:

        TEXT1${KEY1}TEXT2${KEY2}TEXT3

        All keys containing in the repo will be replaces with it's localized values. If the given key is missing, substitution retains ${KEYN} mark unchanged. It allows to use chained substitutions

        Parameters:
        source - string to substitute data to. Can't be null
        Returns:
        substituted string
        Throws:
        ContentException - when substitution format corrupted
        See Also:
        substitute(String,String)

      • substitute

        public String substitute(String source,
                         String defaultValue)
                  throws ContentException

        Substitute string (or default value if source string is null) with the multilanguage string context.

        Parameters:
        source - string to substitute data to
        defaultValue - default value for the source string if null. Can't be null
        Returns:
        substituted string
        Throws:
        ContentException - any error in content
        See Also:
        substitute(String)
